notes: Fourth-generation Legacy midsize sedan and wagon. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Legacy GT turbocharged variant and 3.0R six-cylinder available. Manual transmission available on select models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Legacy article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation Outback wagon based on Legacy platform. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Optional flat-six engine. Increased ground clearance and rugged styling. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Outback article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.5L EJ25 turbo boxer H4 (243/250 hp XT)
notes: Third-generation Outback based on fourth-generation Legacy. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbocharged XT and six-cylinder 3.0R variants available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Outback article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.0L EJ20 turbo boxer H4 (227 hp WRX)
2.5L EJ25 turbo boxer H4 (300 hp STI)
notes: Second-generation Impreza compact car. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. WRX turbocharged variant available from 2002. WRX STI high-performance variant introduced to U.S. market in 2004. Multiple body styles including sedan, wagon, and hatchback. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.5L EJ25 turbo boxer H4 (265/305 hp WRX/STI)
notes: Third-generation Impreza with revised styling. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. WRX and WRX STI performance variants continue. Sedan and hatchback body styles. Wagon discontinued in U.S. market. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Turbocharged performance variant of Impreza. First generation officially sold in U.S. market. Symmetrical all-wheel drive with driver-controlled center differential. Rally-inspired performance. Difficulty modifier reflects turbocharged engine maintenance and performance-oriented components. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza WRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

High-performance STI variant introduced to U.S. market in 2004. Larger 2.5L turbocharged engine. Six-speed manual transmission. Enhanced suspension, brakes, and aerodynamics. Driver-controlled center differential with multiple modes. High difficulty modifier reflects performance-oriented maintenance, turbo complexity, and specialized components. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza WRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Third-generation Impreza-based WRX with hatchback body style added. Turbocharged 2.5L boxer engine. Symmetrical all-wheel drive. Difficulty modifier reflects turbocharged engine maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza WRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

High-performance STI variant based on third-generation Impreza. Hatchback body style added. Enhanced power output. Six-speed manual transmission. High difficulty modifier reflects performance maintenance requirements. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza WRX article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.5L EJ25 turbo boxer H4 (210/230 hp XT)
notes: Second-generation Forester compact SUV. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbocharged XT variant available with manual or automatic transmission. Increased size compared to first generation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Forester article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.5L EJ25 turbo boxer H4 (224 hp XT)
notes: Third-generation Forester with updated styling. Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbocharged XT variant available. Improved safety features. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Forester article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Three-row midsize SUV built in Lafayette, Indiana. Named B9 Tribeca for first generation (renamed Tribeca from 2008). Flat-six engine standard. Symmetrical all-wheel drive. Controversial original front-end styling revised for 2008. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Tribeca article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Compact pickup/utility vehicle based on Legacy platform. Features open bed with innovative switchback feature (fold-down midgate). Symmetrical all-wheel drive standard. Turbocharged variant available. Built in Lafayette, Indiana. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Baja article, December 19, 2024 revision.
